plotScripts.Scatter plot:
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
data.dropna(axis = 'rows',inplace = True, subset = [!(colsList)])
fig = px.scatter(data,!(xColumnName)!(yColumnName)!(colorColumnName)!(sizeColumnName)!(showRegressionLine)!(markerMaxSize)!(xColumnNames)!(yColumnNames))
fig.update_traces(marker=dict(line=dict(width=0.5,color='DarkSlateGrey')!(markerType)),selector=dict(mode='markers'))
fig.show()
plotScripts.Histogram:
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
data.dropna(axis = 'rows',inplace = True, subset = [!(colsList)])
fig = px.histogram(data, !(valueColumnName)!(colorColumnName)!(xColumnNames)!(yColumnNames)!(bins), marginal="violin", barmode='overlay', opacity = 0.8)
fig.update_layout(bargap=0.1)
fig.show()
plotScripts.Bar chart:
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
fig = px.bar(data.groupby([!(splitColumnName)!(colorColumnName)],as_index=False).agg(!(valueAggrType)), 
             !(splitColumnName)!(valueColumnName)!(colorColumnName)!(xColumnNames)!(yColumnNames),barmode='stack')
fig.update_layout(xaxis={'categoryorder':!(barSortOrder)})
fig.show()
plotScripts.Box plot:
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
data.dropna(axis = 'rows',inplace = True, subset = [!(colsList)])
fig = px.box(data,!(categoryColumnName)!(valueColumnName)!(binColorColumnName)!(xColumnNames)!(yColumnNames),points = 'all')
fig.update_traces(quartilemethod="exclusive")
fig.show()
plotScripts.Correlation plot:
import seaborn as sn
toCorr = !(xColumnNames).split(',')
data.dropna(axis = 'rows',inplace = True, subset = toCorr)
corrMatrix = data[toCorr].corr(!(correlationType))
plt = sn.heatmap(corrMatrix, annot=True)
print(plt)
plotScripts.Line chart:
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
import plotly.graph_objects as go

toLine = !(yColumnNames).split(',')
funs = [!(yAggrTypes)]
data.dropna(axis = 'rows',inplace = True, subset = toLine.append(!(xColumnName)))
fig = make_subplots(rows=len(toLine), cols=1)

for i in range(0,len(toLine)-1):
    summaryDf = data.groupby([!(xColumnName)],as_index=False).agg(funs[i])
    fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=summaryDf[!(xColumnName)], y=summaryDf[toLine[i]], mode='lines', name=toLine[i]),row=i+1, col=1)

print(fig.show())
